newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia Lib Democrats ahead in poll - projection.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia Lib Democrats ahead in poll - projection.

text.p: Slovenian Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek's centre-left Liberal Democrats on Sunday emerged as the biggest party in the second general election since independence from Yugoslavia, computer projections showed.

The projections issued by Slovenian state television showed Drnovsek's party, in power for the past four years, with 27.3 percent of the vote, compared to 23.46 percent in the last general election in 1992.
The rightist People's Party, led by Marjan Podobnik, came a close second with 26 percent of the vote, according to the computer projections.
The People's Party has called for caution in Slovenia's bid to join the European Union, saying farmers in particular should be protected from the full rigours of competition.
The centre-right Social Democrats, headed by former defence minister Janez Jansa, were projected to come third with 14 percent, followed by the Christian Democrats with nine percent.
The United List of Social Democrats, the former communists, took five percent of votes, with the DeSUS (repeat DeSUS) party, representing pensioners on four percent, the projections showed.
